CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Consistent with the observed homogeneous donor : acceptor network with the smallest rms roughness , the PffBB-14 - based device exhibited the highest J sc of 16.77 mA cm^-2 and FF of 64.36% , suggesting efficient charge dissociation and transport.

Let's think step by step.

1. PffBB-14

This is a material name. It is the specific material (PffBB-14) that was used in the device and exhibited the highest J sc (current density) and FF (fill factor) in the observed homogeneous donor : acceptor network.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

1. PffBB-14

This is the only entity in the paragraph that can be clearly identified as a material name. All other entities in the paragraph refer to specific properties or measurements of the material (J sc, FF, homogeneous donor : acceptor network, rms roughness, efficient charge dissociation, and transport) rather than the material itself.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Consistent with the observed homogeneous donor : acceptor network with the smallest rms roughness , the PffBB-14 - based device exhibited the highest J sc of 16.77 mA cm^-2 and FF of 64.36% , suggesting efficient charge dissociation and transport.

Let's think step by step.

1. homogeneous donor : acceptor network
2. smallest rms roughness
3. PffBB-14 - based device

5. 16.77 mA cm^-2
6. FF (Fill Factor)
7. 64.36%

1. smallest rms roughness
2. J sc (Junction Scanning)
3. 16.77 mA cm^-2

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Consistent with the observed homogeneous donor : acceptor network with the smallest rms roughness , the PffBB-14 - based device exhibited the highest J sc of 16.77 mA cm^-2 and FF of 64.36% , suggesting efficient charge dissociation and transport.

Let's think step by step.

1. rms roughness: This is a quantitative property that describes the roughness or irregularity of a surface. In this context, it refers to the smallest root mean square roughness of the donor : acceptor network.
2. J sc: This is a property that represents the short-circuit current density, which is the current that flows through a photovoltaic device under short-circuit conditions. In this context, it is the highest short-circuit current density of 16.77 mA cm^-2 for the PffBB-14 - based device.
3. FF: This is a property that represents the fill factor, which is a measure of the efficiency of a photovoltaic device at converting solar energy into electricity. In this context, it is the fill factor of 64.36% for the PffBB-14 - based device.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

1. J sc: This is a material property of the PffBB-14 - based device, representing the highest short-circuit current density of 16.77 mA cm^-2.
2. FF: This is a material property of the PffBB-14 - based device, representing the fill factor of 64.36%.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| Highest short-circuit current density of 16.77 mA cm^-2 for the PffBB-14 - based device |
| Fill factor of 64.36% for the PffBB-14 - based device |
